item.title: Heather add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "I did then what I knew how to do. Now that I know better, I do better." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Heather add a quote by Zora Neale Hurston
item.description: "Ships at a distance have every man's wish on board." -- Zora Neale Hurston

item.title: Heather add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Heather add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "Listen to the mustn'ts, child. Listen to the don'ts. Listen to the shouldn'ts, the impossibles, the won'ts. Listen to the never haves, then listen close to me... Anything can happen, child. Anything can be." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Heather add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "But the Hebrew word, the word timshel—‘Thou mayest’— that gives a choice. It might be the most important word in the world. That says the way is open. That throws it right back on a man. For if ‘Thou mayest’—it is also true that ‘Thou mayest not." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Heather add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Heather add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "There's some heinous fuckery goin' on mon." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Heather add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "Blessed are the dumbfucks." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Heather add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "Only cops and vampires have to have an invitation to enter." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Heather add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "I've seen more intelligence in the crotch lice of harem whores." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Heather add a quote by Stephenie Meyer
item.description: "He's like a drug for you, Bella." -- Stephenie Meyer

item.title: Heather add a quote by A.A. Milne
Heather add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "If you live to be a hundred, I want to live to be a hundred minus one day so I never have to live without you." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Heather add a quote by Margaret Mead
item.description: "Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed, citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has." -- Margaret Mead

item.title: Heather add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Creativity is knowing how to hide your sources" -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Heather add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "I'm not upset that you lied to me, I'm upset that from now on I can't believe you." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Heather add a quote by SARK
item.description: "If she got really quiet and listened, new parts of her wanted to speak." -- SARK

item.title: Heather add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "If you are a dreamer come in If you are a dreamer a wisher a liar A hoper a pray-er a magic-bean-buyer If youre a pretender com sit by my fire For we have some flax golden tales to spin Come in! Come in!" -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Heather add a quote by Frances Hodgson Burnett
item.description: "It made her think that it was curious how much nicer a person looked when he smiled. She had not thought of it before." -- Frances Hodgson Burnett

item.title: Heather add a quote by Frances Hodgson Burnett
item.description: "She made herself stronger by fighting with the wind." -- Frances Hodgson Burnett

item.title: Heather add a quote by Frances Hodgson Burnett
item.description: "As she came closer to him she noticed that there was a clean fresh scent of heather and grass and leaves about him, almost as if he were made of them. She liked it very much and when she looked into his funny face with the red cheeks and round blue eyes she forgot that she had felt shy." -- Frances Hodgson Burnett
